Reviews.Title: Excellent pix, lots of easy to use features, great movies
Reviews.Author: Kepela "kepela"
Reviews.Content: This is really tiny and I love carrying it all the time. I had the A10, A30 and now the A40 and they are all great cameras. This has easy access to flash options (off, on, red eye, soft etc) as well as focal lengths (macro, super macro, infinity etc). The screen is nearly as big as the camera and makes for great viewing of your photos and movies. The flash works pretty good, even up to distances of greater than 20 feet. It's really easy to set up and understand. The zoom is steady and you can view the screen all the time you're zooming with little or no distortion. I notice a slight purple cast from outdoor light coming in from windows (indoors), but I have a Canon sd950is that does the same thing, so I think this is something with most if not all digital cameras. It's so small and light it's really nice to carry around and the photos are really fantastic. The anti shake is the best I've seen on any brand of digital camera, I have a 16 month old I'm always chasing around, so I really appreciate the anti shake feature. It's a hundred dollars less then the Canon and I'm not sure why because I like the Pentax better.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, kind of slow
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. Walther "schmaofizzle"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, it has a quick startup (not counting charging the flash) and it does everything a point and shoot should.--> Make sure you use one of the high speed sandisk cards<--The pictures can be over 2 megs a piece, if you dont, the camera lags tremendously (I was about to send it back)Also, the directions say the charger lights green and goes out when charged, in reality, it lights red when charging and turns green when done.

Reviews.Title: Small camera, big features
Reviews.Author: Credomatic "epesa"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera with a lot of features.What I like:12 MP, 3 systems of shake reduction, High Dynamic Range, manual focus in almost all modes (you can record a movie in macro, super macro, manual focus, excellent!), ISO range (you can decide a maximun auto ISO), document photos are very clear (I like negative mode to take pictures of my 35mm negatives films), fast focus mode, big movies with a small size.What I don't like:Big problem - you can disable Face Priority in Auto mode, this causes the camera found "ghost faces" in what are you focus (my camera found 5 faces when I was taking a picture to a TV remote control). This also causes the camera fires red eye reduction flash (when is not necessary) and the battery runs low too fast. You can not change the zoom in movie mode(while recording). You can record more than 2 hours in HQ but the battery only give 1 hour of life.I ask people from Pentax to give the posibility to disable Face Pripority in auto mode in the next firmware (please, please!!!).

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: LynneG "Yarn Yearner, Story Seeker, Legend Lo...
Reviews.Content: Got the camera for my wife to replace one that broke.  She doesn't go anywhere without it, is always snapping pix.  Not an SLR or anything professional, but great quality for its size, great for all-around picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Good easy to use.
Reviews.Author: J. Bradley
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife's BD, she loves it.  Packed with nice features that  makes it easy for a non technical person to take nice photos.

Reviews.Title: Small Camera; Big Sensor
Reviews.Author: Bob S.
Reviews.Content: Pentax Optio A40 12MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Shake Reduction ZoomI bought this after a professional photographer showed me his 10 megapixel Pentax last year. When I saw they had just introduced a 12 mp with new features I spent the additional money. It's large LCD viewfinder is good (but it's not up to DSLR precision with thru-the-lens viewing). I carry it in my pocket when I'm traveling/sightseeing or at family functions and don't want to lug my DSLR & lenses around. For that the Optio A40 is great.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio A 40 observations
Reviews.Author: Robert H. Koch
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera for about 3 months now, and overall it's been great. I particularly love the 'double flower' mode that gets me to the short hair.I take some pictures of small machinery, like phone parts, and electronic gadgets, and the double flower mode gets me in there just fine.On the down side, i find that occasionally, the focus seems to be just bad.  I think i am not giving it enuf time to think, but even when i give it time, it just blows the focus entirely.  Since i have lots of memory (4 gigs), my answer to this is simply to take multiple shots of the same item.Battery time tween charges seems a bit short, but not impossible. I charge on average every 3- 4 days with about 30 pix a day.I am still failing to get the movies to show on my puter. Something aboutDV... mode. Irfanview won't deal. Also, a movie intered into the flash card months ago will not purge when i delete pix, so every time i upload, i have to upload THAT movie, even tho i cleared the memory umpteen times.-Bobby Koch

Reviews.Title: Do you like blurry pictures? (updated to four stars 7/3/09)
Reviews.Author: erictheelephant "IronBuddha"
Reviews.Content: ***(READ UPDATED 7/3/09 COMMENT ON BOTTOM!)***I'm writing this because even though I spent much less than retail on this camera, I am disappointed. I was convinced by the reviews that I was getting a spectacular deal, but either mine is defective, or everyone else has low expectations. I have used this camera for about 2 months, so I know how frustrating this camera really is.I have always used Canon or Olympus, and I wanted to stray and try something different. My mistake, Pentax's autofocus takes forever to focus, then when I snap the picture, it's blurry. I get clear pictures only 1/2 to 2/3rds of the time. This is particularly frustrating when you're spending great effort to get kids to stay still for the shot, then snap, it's another lousy shot. I was taking pictures in clear daylight, holding the button halfway, waited a few seconds 'til I got the green focus confirmation square - and after doing this on myriad occasions, still I had blurry shots on the faces I was focusing on. By then, the kids all run off because they're not interested in waiting forever. It's even worse on low light situations such as museums where you're not supposed to use flash. I had to delete many photos of my daughter that were one of a kind in front of some exhibits she just had to be photographed with. When you're with a tour group being rushed, you have no second chances. . .The blurryness is the worst of it, but I also don't like the way you have to go into a menu to switch to video mode. You can't just use a hard switch, and get there like all other cameras I have. I'm constantly switching from video to still mode when I'm photographing my children, and it's a drag to pull up a menu every single time I want to do that.Just buy a Canon. Don't spare the expense for an easy to use camera that you can trust.!!!UPDATED 7/3/09 Opinion: Raise it to about 4 stars, but with qualifiers.I just spent about 4-5 hours (no kidding! but i am a careful reader, and I fidget with the camera while reading) reading the manual and fiddling with the camera. There are many functions on this thing, and if you're willing to learn it, it's well worth the money I paid for it. Still getting some blurry shots often, but I'm confident I can do better with the features I've since learned. While reading the manual, I found a "Green Mode" for supposed foolproof shooting. I found a focus area selection which allows me to do spot focusing, which means I should have less false targets, and blurryness.I found cute border frames online (about 100 designs) that you can photoshop your childrens' faces into. You have to upload them from the Pentax site, but then you can plug them into your onboard camera memory to adjust and edit on the camera. Basically, you can photoshop your kids face to have dog ears on it, or put it into a cute heart border.There is a sharpness adjustment somewhere on the firmware, but I don't know if that's where my blurriness is coming from. With all the onboard features, I'm sure I can somehow make this camera work for me.Canon still rocks out of the box, but this Pentax can give a lot of satisfaction if you are a manual reader. (Maybe I should read the Canon Manuals I have some day, I might be surprised what I can do with them other than getting easy, clear pictures. Forgive me for resisting learning anything new, I'm feeling too old to do anything other than press the shutter button these days.)

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio A40
Reviews.Author: F. Tavani "babbo100"
Reviews.Content: This pocket camera does everything I desire and more.  It is small, the small dimensions is the reason I bought it, takes very good pictures and it's easy to use.  It has as a bonus a sleek body.Particularly like the shake reduction mode that increases the chances of a good clear photo.This is my second digital Pentax Optio camera, after the optio 5i, which still works very well after 3 years.  I followed up wwith the A40.I do miss the panaroma mode, that stiches photos together, that the 5i had, but I have no complaints.  I highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Seattlebear
Reviews.Content: This camera was recommened by PC World and highly rated in Consumer Reports.  It is last year's model so it was considerably less expensive than when it is was new.  Also, Pentax was bought out by Hoya so the newer cameras will have the new name.So far, the camera has performed flawlessly.  I bought this one because of the ratings and because it has a rechargeable battery.  I find using AA or AAA's to be a pain in the neck.  It is definitely a bargain.

Reviews.Title: pentax optio  a40
Reviews.Author: Laura M. Nicholson
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera.  I went with Pentax because I've used a Pentax K1000 ever since I was a teenager.  I ran across the A40 when I was looking for a camera that would work with a Macintosh computer.  The A40 is great and very easy to use.  All my friends are impressed with the pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio A40 --- Rocks MTV
Reviews.Author: Michael Du
Reviews.Content: My favorite electronics brand is Sony.  But like many other brands, Sony does not let you put the date on each photo you take anymore.Date stamp is the most important feature to me.  I want to look back 10 years down the road and know instantly when the picture was taken.  Fortunately Pentax cameras allow you to do that.I always knew Pentax cameras were great!  This Optio A40 is absolutely awesome.  Totally love it.  I bought Nikon's S60 earlier but hated the picture quality so I returned it.  This A40 offers superb quality photos.  Yes, Canon shots are the sharpest.  But again, Canon doesn't have the Date Stamp feature so I don't want it.I do a lot of global traveling, surfing and snowboarding each year.  This camera absolutely rocks and fits the purpose.Being a marketing guy myself, I am very finicky about the brand and its image.  Pentax rocks amongst all brands out there --- solid, practical, no-frills.  Not everyone has it.  Not many people know it since it's not on the shelf of typical electronics store.Michael Dujoymikey@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Chiasson
Reviews.Content: We had the optio A20 but we had an accident and dropped the camera. So we found this one (A40). Its almost like the A20. I loved the A20, now I love the A40. Easy to use, easy to edit pics (using computer software) & capture video.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Carla Reed "Creed"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a backup for my Canon digital SLR and my Canon S5 IS. I needed a smaller camera to carry in my purse for quick shots of the kids. As you can see I am a loyal Canon fan. After researching cameras and reading numerous reviews I came accross this Pentax. The reviews were mostly positive and the price was in my price range. I took a chance and ordered it. I could not be happier. The size is just right to carry in my pocket or bag. Although some might find it harder to hold being it is very small (about the size of a credit card only thicker, of course!) The darn little camera has too many choices and my husband thinks it is smarter than use both. I only received it yesterday so I do have a lot of reading to do. The manual is only in English (a plus for me) and is about an inch thick. You can edit your pics straight from the camera. I really need to play with it a while more before I can give a better review. So far its great!The only cons I have are:the rechargeable battery. As I like to just grab batteries and go. I must now remember to charge this one up. Probably not a problem for most I would assume. And the fact that it has so many options, it is going to take me awhile to learn all its features correctly. Again, not a prblem for most, but I like to take the easy route when possible. Good thing it has the "green " function meaning it takes great auto pics.For $138.00 I think it is a keeper for sure.

Reviews.Title: lcd display is awful - broke 2x
Reviews.Author: bad pentax
Reviews.Content: i bought one, the lcd display exploded (means the inside busted and spiderweb across the screen, couldnt see the photos i took) which rendered the device useless.  i bought a 2nd one and it happened again.  i was over 1 year but sent to pentax in AZ which they told me it would be $90 to repair each camera.  no thanks, i can buy a brand new one for $95!  lousy customer service if you have problems.  very tempermental, find another option, its cheap for a reason.  buy a good one and spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: a flaky camera.
Reviews.Author: Coley B. Duncan, MD "ID Doc"
Reviews.Content: My wife thought she did not know how to operate it, but it turns out that the camera is just not reliable.  While trying to take pictures of our children on Santa's lap, it just died on me.  Lense telescoped out.  Screen black.  Just dead.  Nothing I did to it would get it going again.  I gave up and took the photos with my cell phone which did not take very good pictures.  My wife took the battary out and reinstalled it, and it went to working again.  She said that it has been flaking out on her like that for months, but she thought it was her, not the camera.  Of course, I cannot keep a camera that goes dead when you really need it.  This camera is only about 20 months old.  We have never dropped it and we took excellent care of it.  It still looks brand new.  It is just unreliable.  Do not buy a Pentax.  Buy something else, a Nikon, a Canon, a Sony or a Panasonic, but not a Pentax.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot...
Reviews.Author: Craig Rutkowske
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera up about a year ago for a discounted price of around 100 dollars.  I got it to replace my 6 year old Canon Powershot S40 which I had bought freshmen year of college.  I would definitely NOT pay 280 dollars for it as listed here on Amazon though, it's not worth that at all.  You can find far superior cameras for equiavlent or maybe even cheaper prices.This camera has been excellent so far. It's got a great set of features and the battery life lasts for quite some time.  The camera is incredibly easy to operate and the automatic mode selection works quite well.  The pictures it takes are great as long as there is adequate light. They are very colorful and it is rare that they turn out blurry unless it is in the dark.The camera is light weight and easily fits in the pocket of my jeans. If you're female, it probably won't simply because you ladies have those extremely tiny pockets!The camera is also rather durable and has taken quite a beating. I took it with me to Hawaii on several hikes and even took the camera on a 'cave tubing' trip.  I took it inside a plastic bag as it is obviously not waterproof. The camera did end up getting a little wet and the inside of the bag was damp, but the camera functioned no problem and has worked fine for over 6 months after.The only real drawbacks I have to say the camera has are that it takes lousy pictures in the dark and that the flash sometimes takes an excessive amount of time to charge.

Reviews.Title: Pentax Optio
Reviews.Author: Retired Maven
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera. Lots of features. More thanexpected. Item was shipped the same day asordered. Fantastic service!!! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: One Year and Counting
Reviews.Author: Gene Mcvay
Reviews.Content: I stick the Optio A40 in my right pocket and my cell phone in my left.  It has become part of my daily equipment.  As state commander of The American Legion I find myself in situations that I want to document all the time and share on facebook with friends.  My Nikon digital SLR is not something I can carry around so the Pentax makes me very happy.  I can't remember the last time I drug out the Nikon.After a few minutes the user can easily navigate the camera features and change modes, macro, flash, self timer, etc.  Preview is simple as is delete.  To transfer images I just select all and drag to the folder I choose.  Downloading 200 pictures takes a few seconds.I have used the movie mode a few times and the HD moves compare to my HD JVC Camcorder, except the sound of course.You can check out the pictures I have taken on my facebook page:  Gene McVayI hope you enjoy this camera as much as I have.  I would like to have a Pentax with 5X zoom but have not decided which one.

Reviews.Title: Pentax A40: Does it all!
Reviews.Author: Dana N. Krizan
Reviews.Content: This little camera can hold it's own against any of those more expensive point and shoot cameras. The only hick ups I've come across are the auto focusing on non detailed images and the lag time when the flash is being used. But of all the point and shoot cameras I've played with this is the fastest one yet. Take the time to research this camera and I truly believe you will end up buying it.

Reviews.Title: buy a nikon
Reviews.Author: M. Otterstetter
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a piece of junk!!!  This thing rarely focuses correctly.  I just got the camera back from pentax because I thought it was broken.  It wasn't broken, it's just a poor excuse for a camera.  Not only does it not focus correctly, it has noise coming out the wazoo!  12 megapixels?...right!  Would that be 12 megapixels only in full sun???  Because if the flash goes off...you're pretty much limited to wallet size pictures.  Don't waste your time or money...buy a canon or Nikon - my brother's 100 dollar Kodak takes much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Beth Ireland
Reviews.Content: I am no expert with cameras, but I found the operation of this one to be easy -the size is small an compact -the pictures are great. Since I have had this camera everyone keeps commenting on how great my pictures are, and I know it is not me.

Reviews.Title: Awesome gift!
Reviews.Author: Chello "TLC"
Reviews.Content: My wife totally surprised me with this gift and it might sound ironic because I surprised her with the same one in return. We both bought the same camera to each other and love it! The digital shake reduction is a great feature which allows us to capture great shots. I am not interested in any other camera for a while thanks to this product.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Gorski "Matt"
Reviews.Content: I'm a camera nut for years having the standard Nikons and started goin' with digitals. The ones I had were good. Then I saw the things the Pentax Optio A40 could do and it seemed very affordable, so I got one. BAMM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Everything perfect but the battery
Reviews.Author: ANTONIO FRAGOSO
Reviews.Content: The camera works perfect and the images are so clear. The only problem is the battery wich last only 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Stephen G. Horlick
Reviews.Content: When turned off the front of the lens is flush with the front of the camera.  It took some hunting to find a photo that showed that feature before I purchased it.The features and shooting options are amazing in a sub-compact camera.

Reviews.Title: camera is the best i've ever owned reccommend highly
Reviews.Author: James A. Wells
Reviews.Content: the camera i purchased is fantastic and amazon customer service outstanding I would highly reccomend to friends and also reccomond amazon .com

Reviews.Title: I was happy, but...
Reviews.Author: Manuel Camacho
Reviews.Content: New feedback may 2008!I have had this camera for several months right now, i am going to change it for a SONY cybershot 12.1, This Pentax is a good machine but i am not happy with some topics:CONS: A lot of grain images at high ISO, also not so good pictures at 12mp specially landscapes in sunny environments (I live in South america and those are frecuent situations)ManuelHi, this little machine is nice, small and has outstading resolutionI have used it for one week, i will update my review in one monthPros: Size, large images, display, easy to use menu, price (outstanding qualiy for low price)Cons: It is slow using flash, video is just good enough

Reviews.Title: Incredible Deal !!  then needed Warrany Repair
Reviews.Author: Battlepoint "Mike"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the A40 in March 2009 for an incredible price, $105.  Unfortunately it lasted about a month and then the lens would not retract.  I mailed it back to Pentax in CO.  They completed the repair and returned it.  I was a little worried due to a previous posting that a scratched camera was not repaired.  However, being only a month old and scratch free things went smoothly.  Repair took about 4 weeks, but may take 6 weeks and possibly more.  If you want to track the repair you need to call them after they receive it and request a login to track repair status.  Otherwise they there is no communication.  Customer support was very friendly.  RMA forms and info are all at the Pentax website so you don't have to call them if you are trusting.I can only compare this camera to the Pentax Optio S40 I have owned for 4 years.  The A40 has much better battery life, the S40 eats 2 AA way to fast.  A40 lithium charger is on a detachable cord, I wish it just plugged in, i.e. no cord.  The S40 is very slow at taking pictures, the A40 is super fast.  A40 has a much larger screen but not as large as the competition.  The A40 is not a slim as the Canon cameras but not that fat either.  The S40 took all kinds of abuse and it still works although the eating batteries thing drives me crazy as it only drinks a little juice and then needs fresh AA's.  I am hoping that the A40 won't need the motor replaced again.  Otherwise I am very happy with the camera quality especially due to the price.

Reviews.Title: Not very high quality!
Reviews.Author: Aaron J. Smith
Reviews.Content: My camera refused to retract the lens only 5 weeks after I bought it. Pentax refused to repair it because they said I dropped it. I baby my electronics so much it makes my girlfriend jealous. It was a failed motor inside of the unit, but because it had a small scuff mark on it, they invalidated my warranty and refused to repair it. And they want me to pay for shipping so they can send it back, after I paid to ship it there! Unconscionable! I wised up and bought a Panasonic Lumix, and couldn't be happier. The Penatax takes really blurry pictures at night, my Panasonic takes awesome pictures, at all times of the day or night.
